qas.question: What is the Shia Islam doctrine called?
Who do the Shia believe are the true successors of Muhammad?
What is the role of Imams?

answers.text: providing commentary and interpretation of the Quran

qas.question: Who do the Shia believe are possessed of divine knowledge and authority?

context: <a0_0>Imamah<a0_0/> (Arabic: إمامة‎) is the Shia Islam doctrine (belief) of religious, spiritual and political leadership of the Ummah. The Shia believe that the <a1_0><a3_0>Imams<a3_0/><a1_0/> are the true Caliphs or rightful successors of Muhammad, and further that Imams are possessed of divine knowledge and authority (Ismah) as well as being part of the Ahl al-Bayt, the family of Muhammad. These Imams have the role of <a2_0>providing commentary and interpretation of the Quran<a2_0/> as well as guidance to their tariqa followers as is the case of the living Imams of the Nizari Ismaili tariqah.
